title: Stepstowealth
author: Stepstowealth
content: I want to do better and make a better contribution to increase the popularity of bitcoins around me. My last attempt to get stickers was not as effective as I felt it would be, so I want to do better.I received many tips on my previous post about My step to promote bitcoin and how to make it better and have more effective stickers for promotion, thanks to you all, but majorly the two that I picked out are; I could use a better quote for bitcoins in the stickers, and I should attach a QR link to a website that has good information about what bitcoins is, so the sticker can provide more information. I will like to act on these, so I am back to ask.Suggest a website with good information and helpful resources about bitcoins that can help first time readers.Suggest a better quote for the stickers. (I will tell them to produce them with different quotes this time).

comments.author: eddie.gouws
comments.body: The best step to promote is to use not to invest and to trade on it all those things are good but the crucial thing to to do is to create a decentralized currency that is free and non governed by anyone we may be quite a way from such a thing. BUT if we use bitcoin for our transaction then there is no better way for a stable bitcoin and soon mainstream. Have in mind that bitcoin at the moment is popular and not mainstream with less than 2% of the word owning it.

comments.author: coinremitter
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on January 27, 2023, 07:44:38 AMI want to do better and make a better contribution to increase the popularity of bitcoins around me. My last attempt to get stickers was not as effective as I felt it would be, so I want to do better.I received many tips on my previous post about My step to promote bitcoin and how to make it better and have more effective stickers for promotion, thanks to you all, but majorly the two that I picked out are; I could use a better quote for bitcoins in the stickers, and I should attach a QR link to a website that has good information about what bitcoins is, so the sticker can provide more information. I will like to act on these, so I am back to ask.Suggest a website with good information and helpful resources about bitcoins that can help first time readers.Suggest a better quote for the stickers. (I will tell them to produce them with different quotes this time).Hi,The thing that you are doing is very impressive because the way you are spreading awareness about Bitcoin in your area really thrilled us. However, as you said you want a reliable source that people can easily understand about bitcoin then here I am giving you a link to that blog. https://coinremitter.com/what-is-bitcoin read this carefully.Apart from that, the idea you have about stickers is quite good but we need more effective and social media is one of the most effective things. After all, we need a digital thing to spread awareness about digital currency. I am giving you a suggestion. You better go on Facebook and find a community group of your country and post in that group accordingly. Share some photos on your WhatsApp groups and do on.This is the thing I am suggesting you.

comments.author: aylabadia05
comments.body: The site https://bitcoin.org/en/ offered by Lucius is perfect for getting information about Bitcoin. For me, what he said in your previous topic entitled My step to promote bitcoin is the best solution to avoid things that are not in accordance with your original goal of promoting Bitcoin in your neighbourhood.Unlike us who cannot directly promote because Bitcoin still cannot be fully used as a means of payment.On this occasion, I would like to say that it works great. Then you are among those who really appreciate every suggestion and input given by others for positive progress. Keep it up my friend.If I may know, do you already know how to make a QR code? or you need to learn to be able to make it.We're looking forward to the next result.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on January 27, 2023, 07:44:38 AMSuggest a website with good information and helpful resources about bitcoins that can help first time readers.Suggest a better quote for the stickers. (I will tell them to produce them with different quotes this time).Personally, that would be (1) https://learnmeabitcoin.com/. Not only it explains bitcoin in a beginner friendly manner but it also provides funny illustrations that will make the learning more enjoyable and interesting especially for visual learners.There are other resources as well:- Compiled resources about BTC - https://www.lopp.net/- Anything related to security - https://cryptosec.info/- Videos - https://youtube.com/@aantonop

comments.author: Flexystar
comments.body: You can always insert top informative websites which were the “originals” and were the first to create blockchain followed by Bitcoin. That is best way to direct them towards successful bitcoin adoption. I think spreading link about the bitcointalk forum can also add much of the value to this. I’m not saying this because we love this forum but out of one vital point and that’s Mr Satoshi’s earlier presence in here. That would some interesting content for them to read about. I think there are some threads which has collected all the posts from Satoshi which can also be linked to this QR thus creating loads of interest in the whole thing. :-)Good luck and you are doing great job.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Truth be told — unfortunately there's little we can do in getting people to actually get genuinely interested in bitcoin. Just like most things, people will only realize the importance of something(bitcoin in this case) when they finally actually need it.Quote from: Stepstowealth on January 27, 2023, 07:44:38 AMSuggest a website with good information and helpful resources about bitcoins that can help first time readers.* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://cryptosec.info* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: If I remember well, I suggested that you add a better slogan in a prior article. The idea of stickers isn't bad at all when applied to a moving object like an automobile. So many individuals will see the stickers. However, it would be great if the website had an instructive slogan and QR codes. People can look up additional information rapidly. You can select the best quote by asking for a better one here. By the way, I appreciate your efforts to spread the word about Bitcoin.

comments.author: electronicash
comments.body: a slogan for bitcointalk.org that is to be stuck on the back of the car saying  "Join the community, Bitcointalk.org"  the forum is a good source of information. no one would doubt that. Car stickers in the back are very easy to notice by the people inside the next vehicle. is this possible to add the QR on the sticker that will go to a Binance referral link?

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Focus your advertisement on young people. There are more chances they adopt bitcoin than the older generations.Instead of superficial ads through sitckers, talk to people personally. A direct approach is more likely to turn into success.Use the interest of each person you talk with in the favour of bitcoin. Let's say the person likes gambling, then talk about crypto casinos. If the person is a merchant, tell him he can import goods paying with bitcoin. If the person is an investor, promote bitcoin as an asset to be held on long run. Always highlight the feature which looks more persuasive depending the situation.

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: There are many things you could do to better promote Bitcoin in addition to stickers, some ideas could be a site or blog where you explain the basics for newbies or a YouTube channel or podcast, or you could go around promoting this technology perhaps by organizing meetups .  I don't think a sticker can highlight bitcoin.

comments.author: famososMuertos
comments.body: The first thing that occurs to me is to ask you, why is it necessary for you to be so specific and punctual in promoting?On the other hand, and in times where it is so easy to access a massive audience using any of the existing channels of social networks, it is confusing to understand him in his insistence on imagining that there is something better than what has already been done, in that idea....anyway:Carnivals are coming, I don't know if in your country or community they celebrate such parties, (1) wear a Bitcoin-themed costume.(2) Contest, offer a prize for the best costume...!

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: There are really lots of ways to promote Bitcoin, just as there are lots of ways to promote personal and commercial businesses. You can run a street awareness campaign about Bitcoin by carrying a huge microphone on the street, the same way they preach the word of God. Me personally, I am planning on getting an HTML GIF design for my local currency rate calculator, where anyone who visits there will be able to see the ad, and if they click it, it will take them to a detailed write-up about Bitcoin and crypto currency at large. Either the Bitcoin Whitepaper, a YouTube video, or even this forum link were all about Bitcoin being discussed.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on January 27, 2023, 07:44:38 AMSuggest a website with good information and helpful resources about bitcoins that can help first time readers.For newbies, they don't need too advanced resources to read.They must start with something really basics but attractive like how to store bitcoin, how to use it for transactions. They must also know about why one transaction is confirmed shortly within a few blocks and another one has to wait for many hours or days. If they understand it, they understand how Bitcoin network works to confirm transactions and won't be panic when their transactions are stucked on the network by waiting for confirmations from miners in mempools.A first and very important step to learn is how to store bitcoin very safely, how to secure their wallets. To do this, they must choose good wallet softwares to use.[General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?And use strong password to protect their wallet[GUIDE] How to Create a Strong/Secure PasswordAre you passwords in the green?

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on January 27, 2023, 07:44:38 AMSuggest a website with good information and helpful resources about bitcoins that can help first time readers.There's no better place to have a good start that will be more than the bitcoin community platform itself which is bitcointalk.org here where you are right now, all you need is to be patient, read and learn, there are various boards you could use to improve yourself about bitcoin, I don't expect you to embark on teaching others when you yourself is yet to get along with the whole system in bitcoin, because you may be asked a question that will surprised you that you have no idea on the answer to give, but your intention to help with promoting bitcoin is a good idea.

comments.author: Xxmodded
comments.body: How possibility effective promote Bitcoin trough sticker? this digital era and young generation have been popular with many kinds of social media, I think why not try with modern way for promoting Bitcoin without have use sticker? Better check with your young generation in your placed what most traffic social media used? You can start with promoting Bitcoin trough social media used by them and I think most effective than using sticker and I don't know still left many people interested with old method for promoting.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: eddie.gouws on January 27, 2023, 09:01:51 AMThe best step to promote is to use not to invest and to trade on it all those things are good but the crucial thing to to do is to create a decentralized currency that is free and non governed by anyone we may be quite a way from such a thing. BUT if we use bitcoin for our transaction then there is no better way for a stable bitcoin and soon mainstream. Have in mind that bitcoin at the moment is popular and not mainstream with less than 2% of the world owning it. You made a good point and that is why I always make the call for self inclusion,  let the quest for knowledge be the motivation behind every step taken toward bitcoin and if investment or trading is put forth it may lead to frustration as the individual will get discouraged if the market goes against them there are several things to take note of when it comes to bitcoin awareness which are: -What is the motivation behind the equation of bitcoin, several others see Bitcoin as a get-rich-quick scheme which is the wrong mentality of the whole concept of bitcoin and its volatilities. -Bitcoin alternative should be the only reason behind Bitcoin adoption and since bitcoin is not a crcrowdfundingcheme there is no need for printing stickers or what have you.

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: You should consider too what kind of community you’ve got because your strategy should be tailored specifically on what your community interest. It’s nonsense to do a promotion strategy if your community wasn’t interested at all on what’s you are doing.In my personal experience, I have a community that involves on business specifically online stores. I promote Bitcoin through giving special discounts on my products when they use Bitcoin. I don’t use fancy advertisements but the discount itself will make my community curious on Bitcoin because I give importance on it. So far I have 3 friends that I’m teaching and using Bitcoin right after they become interested on why I give huge discounts for accepting Bitcoin as payment.

comments.author: Merit.s

comments.body: You have been given some information on the websites that can help people who look at the back of your sticker for easy access to bitcoin knowledge by mk4 and others,so I will like you to put that link there. You could also put this forum website there,for easy access for any interested person to join the forum. You are doing a great job to put effort to make sure that your locality gets the awareness of bitcoin for easy adoption. It will also help if you can have a one on one conversation on bitcoin discussion with people in your locality not only stickers because some people might not have time to access the internet but when you do it orally,I guess those set of people might pick up interest in bitcoin.

comments.author: Broadanbig
comments.body: This is going to be nice you want to promote the adoption and awareness of bitcoin in your locality. Looking at what you have said here and opinions profered, that step would be a good one because that create curiosity from the audience or people to knowing what the bitcoin on the sticker is all about. People would want to know more and it would make the do research on what bitcoin is then they would get insight of the bitcoin movement. I am planning to do a bitcoin promotion in my own way but I would also seek the advise of senior forum members here so I could get a better guidelines on how to go about it so as not to make any mistake.Congratulations mate you did took a good step to wanting to promote bitcoin.
